title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very laidback. Questions were answered and given. There was some talk about my classwork with the related field and a few portfolio questions and sharing. everything was over zoom because of the pandemic.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this internship?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through Handshake, asked to come in for one round interview a few days later, interview was in person and very casual, and was then was notified of results on the same day
Interview Questions:
tell me about a time you worked with others?
how do you stay organized?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Multi day, multiple groups.  Lots of questions from group that i didn't work with much. A lot of the questions were generic but there were some technical and analytical questions in the mix as well.
Interview Questions: Present a research question relevant to the field and analyze it. Prepare a presentation as part of the interview

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process happened over two weeks with three separate interviews. Each interview lasted a little over an hour and you met with different teams or levels of leadership throughout the process.
Interview Questions: How does your education relate to this position?

title: Social Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: relaxed and genuine with over zoom. Asked genuine questions and what I was expecting from the job. Went over my resume and available positions and was very comfortable and open minded
Interview Questions: What is your experience with social media

title: Activity Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of filling out a job application via the college's job board. The interview was done virtually due to covid and overall was well. It was a group-style interview and despite it being multiple people asking questions, I felt at ease while answering. Please be knowledgeable that this is a position working with high school students so tailor answers that would accommodate this.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Have I ever lead a hands-on activity?

title: Senior Audio Visual Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough interview process, conducted virtually via Microsoft Teams. There was a 3 person panel. They took turns asking a set of pre-determined questions, which asked the interviewee about their previous relevant experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you went above and beyond the call of duty. What was the situation and how did you respond?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was late and blamed the staffing process on indeed.  She said that I needed to apply on the university website even though an inperson interview was what she had requested.
Interview Questions: She had no questions, just excuses for not holding the interview.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy - Zoom meeting. Very welcoming and encouraging. Small staff but explained the expectations well. Asked questions about my goals and hobbies. Interested in my studies and how I could apply them to the work.
Interview Questions: Q: Can you manage a social media?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral questions and super chill process. The interviewer makes you feel comfortable. 30 minutes long interview. Really great experience over all. Don’t be hesitant, be on time. Make sure to were a perfect outfit
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour interview. It was fun. They will discuss about technology and some basic questions. If you are interested about any particular Department tell them that you wanna work in there . The people are in there is too good.Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?About you background and so on.

title: DISC JOCKEY Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Easy to get experience in the field of a university job. Laid back during the hiring process. Good team building atmosphere. Fun working for this university. Simple hiring and training process
Interview Questions: Are you a hard worker?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom meeting one on one with PI. Total interview took 45 minutes. Small talk in beginning. Asked about previous experiences. Asked about previous research. shared interests. Then focused on what the current role would look like. What the average week would consist of and if that was something you would like.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest weaknesses

title: General Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Okay, very nice people and with a great sense of humour. 
Nice offices and coffee. 
Super friendly and with great timing. 
2 seps interview, with a 2nd interview onsite. 
Also Interviews online are possible.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Intake phone call to discuss my experience followed by a phone interview. The interviewer was not sure about the job description because roles were shifting at the time. Conversation was disorganized and unclear.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with ambiguity?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process. Went in for my interview and was asked the basic interview questions. Got the job the same day and started about a week or two after my paper work cleared.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Why do you want to work here?

title: Federal Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online using handshake for the federal work-study purpose.  I got an email within 4 business days after applying.  They asked for a video interview schedule. The overall process took 1 week.
Interview Questions:
* Can you tell me about yourself.
*  Why do you want to work here?
* How many hours you can commit to work weekly?
* When can you start the work?
* Do you have any previous experience?

title: HPC Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: They ask about your skills with Linux and physical computers. Know how to use Linux and the terminal. Also be familiar with computer repair. Know how to switch the CPU.  Know how to upgrade RAM. Know how to install a GPU, SSD, and install an operating system.
Interview Questions:
How Experienced are you with Linux. 
Have you ever built or taken apart a computer before.

title: Application Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Remote interview. Took about 15-30 minutes. They ask basic it questions and the steps you take to resolve problem . They also ask you if you know about active directory and Sccm. Interview went really well.
Interview Questions: How do you approach a problem when you can’t solve

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very professional and welcoming. Scheduling the interview was easy. I felt good about the how the overall interview went, even though I didn't get the job. Questions were very standard library interview questions. No awkward or unexpected questions.
Interview Questions: General library interview questions, included what library software I was familiar with, etc

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly straightforward. I met with the supervisor for the position and other members of the team. It somewhat felt like they knew they were't going to choose me. I found out later they went with an internal candidate. I heard that is pretty commonplace at Wayne State. The interviews are more of a formality but they like to promote from within. I can respect that but hate to feel like I'm wasting my time.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (New York, NY) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Three months after applying for the position( and forgetting that I applied),I received a email inviting me to participate in a phone screening. My phone screening was pleasant, and I thought it went very well. It has been two months since my phone screening, and I haven't heard anything. The person I spoke with hasn't responded to any of my emails pertaining to a follow up,  and their mailbox is full.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience in human Resources

title: Academic Services Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: The position opened at the end of March 2019 and I applied online about two weeks later. Didn't hear a thing until Aug. 20th when I got an email saying that given the large pool of applicants, I wouldn't be interviewed. Thought strange for a position where I exceeded all of the preferred qualifications listed. Really? Five months to review the application materials? Seems really disorganized.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Its very simple, you just need to provide them with your resume online and they call you for the interview. You have to appear to them and provide with your availability.
Interview Questions: What do you do and what time are you available.

title: Legal Writing Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted at a conference table with two professors from the faculty hiring committee and two students. The students were allowed to ask questions. The setting was somewhat informal.
Interview Questions: - what is your grading philosophy - how well do you work with other professors

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the university job platform and was called in for an interview a week later. The interview lasted 20 minutes and I had to do online tests to get certified for researching human subjects.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the company and the projects we're working on?

title: Logic Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone interview from thin films group at Intel for a position that I didn't apply to. It took 1 hr 15 mins. It was more like a discussion about the open positions in their group. Awaiting for the results.
Interview Questions: Conflict at work and how you resolved it

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Pretty laid back. Just a couple of quick emails to schedule, then I showed up and answered some basic questions. It didn't take longer than 20 minutes and they told me right away that the job was mine if I wanted it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my online application through the Wayne State job portal and then I was contacted via email to come in for an in person interview. The interviewers were very nice and the environment was not too stressful. Basically asked me to go over my resume and experiences listed on the resume.
Interview Questions: Please explain your experience with X?

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied via a online listing. Got called in by phone. Had a 1:1 interview with the systems administrator. Basic Questions. Got accepted and started the on boarding process within 10 days.
Interview Questions:
Whats your first response when you have a computer that is not booting up.
What is one critical situation where you came up with a solution and made it work.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: it was with the professor and they asked research experience related questions.  especially they focused on previous research papers and academic back ground and GPA. The questions and interview process was successful.
Interview Questions: what is your academic background?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: they didn't ask not a lot of questions. it was basic behavioral based questions. if you have work-study award they literally don't even ask you anything. they will just  ask few basic information.
Interview Questions: basic questions: what year you are in? why you want this job? did you have any experience etc

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions:
Application was through job portal and then, the interview was setup through skype.
The interview is conducted after the lab PI has zeroed in on few candidates. In my case, I believe I was the only candidate interviewed. If they really need you then they will speed up the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Nothing, which I would characterize as difficult.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: In person interview- The questions were based on resume and some behavioral questions. After that they will ask you a situational questions, they will narrate a scenario and you will have to give a response  by stating how will you handle the situation.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working as an Student assistant?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Took over 2 months to be contacted. They never got back with me to inform me whether or not the position was filled.  I'm pretty sure the interview is a scam and is only done as a formality; they already know who they're going to hire before the interview process.
Interview Questions: Describe your judgement in decision making.

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of submitting resume, working on a project to show capability and then an interview. If you clear the interview, salary and work hour discussion. Then I got the result that I got selected.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience you have ?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was an email disbursed by the Electronics and Electrical engineering  department to all the students of Wayne State University. We had to write an email to the specified professor with relevant experience, cover letter and resume attached. Professor gave me a date and time to see him in the room. I went to his room and he asked me a few questions related to MATLAB. I answered some of his questions. He was satisfied with my answers and he offered me a job. He sent me an email with the professor in loop under whom I had to work.
Interview Questions: How much have you worked on MATLAB?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: There was an ad posted on the career website. I applied to it and I received a call from one of the hiring managers. The interview was scheduled and I was selected after all the process was done.
Interview Questions: why should we hire you?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1) Online application
2)Resume filtration
3)One on One Interview (technical). Basic computer science interview questions. Mainly on network administration, computer architecture, operating system, server client  and hardware related maintenance and support
Interview Questions: Basics of computer networking and maintenance

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Overall process were simple and straightforward.  .I posted a resume on university website, and a few days later , got an email for scheduling a phone interview.The manager of this research lab called me  and after two days lab manager asked to come in for a face on interview with their team and the professor of the specific research program who posted the open position.The interview went well, we went over my background and skills, and in  the following week professor called me and offered me this postion.
Interview Questions: Present and past experience in  research

title: Intern Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done via conference call with the Program Coordinator. She was very pleasant and asked some in depth questions. The Coordinator explained the requirements and what was needed to complete the requirements, the she explained the next steps in the process.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose that position with that program?

title: Design Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: First I got a Phone call and then asked for a face to face interview, It was normal kind of interview. I got a final call after two weeks. I was enjoyed working there.
Interview Questions: Which Software do you know better?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Facetime interview first and then is onsite, easy job. Simple questions such as what's your experience, what's your future plan, where are you from and questions about your education. After phone interview is the onsite interview, ask about technical questions.
Interview Questions: What your experience?

title: Human Resources Administrator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Wayne State (Macomb, MI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, completed an assessment and after some follow-up I was contacted for an interview a few months later. The in person interview was panel. The questions were related to on the job experience. Very professional interview team, professional but relaxed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you helped a team member or coworker accomplish a task.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: first we have to contact the professor and talk to him . So he will test your skills and select the project that you will be suitalble for . If you intrested in doing phd it will be more useful. while doing master's you can take also thesis
Interview Questions: what experience do i have in the project and the explain them

title: Director of Business Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was smooth.  I applied for the position on January 3rd.  I was contacted to come in for an interview two weeks later.  The interview committee consisted of the Dean, Associate Dean and the current Director for Business Affairs.  The interview was more conversation based rather than scripted questions.  Nice group of people and the interview went well.  The whole interview lasted an hour.

A week and a half later I received a phone call from HR at Wayne State letting me know another candidate was chosen.  While I was bummed I didn't get the position I appreciated getting an actual phone call from a person rather than a form rejection letter.

The downside was no feedback was provided why I was not the chosen candidate.  That type of information would be invaluable to applicants so you could know what your strengths and weaknesses were.  I would be nice if applicant feedback was incorporated into the interview process.

Overall I had a positive experience.  Of course I would have loved an offer but that wasn't meant to be.  :-)
Interview Questions:
What is your management style?
How do you handle conflict?
What experience do you have with budgets?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was through a referral program with minimal interview questions - just how many hours can can work and when can you start and the rest of the training began soon after.
Interview Questions:
When can you start? 
How many hours can you work?
Do you have any experience with excel or word?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email a few days after I put in my application and then had a quick phone interview where I was asked about my education and professional background. I set up an in person interview and spoke with human resources about how I handle difficult situations and why I thought I would be a good fit. I then had a computer test with basic math questions. The next day I had a final interview with the doctor I would be working directly for.
Interview Questions: Do you watch the clock and wait for your shift to be over?

title: Clerical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wayne State in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through work study .  Went to career center and found job .  Applied immediately and got offered a interview .  The interview was simple .  People were very nice .
Interview Questions: What days were I available ?

title: Grants Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview with standard interview questions. You can find pretty much any interview guide online to help prepare. Obviously some jobs will have some more tailored questions but they are all pretty much use behavior interview style.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Student Assistant Housing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Resume Review and Call
Reviews housing details and make sure the candidate is part of wayne state housing.
Calls out for personal interview and review with the resident advisors for the profile fit.
Interview Questions: What are most Difficult situations you handled in previous job?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very  straight to the point questions during the interview.  The interviewer was  a senior application analyst that worked for the IT department .   Overall the interview  experience was very  positive .
Interview Questions: Describe  a project you worked on

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview with the hiring committee (4-5 people) followed by in-person interview with the same hiring committee where different, more in depth questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Overall career goals and how you would utilize this program and employment opportunity together to reach those goals.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Was referred by department chair to another faculty in another college.  Word of mouth.  Interviewed by two others and brought CV in interview.  

Answered all questions honestly and discussed previous college teaching experience.
Interview Questions:
What is your
Teaching pedagogy?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Submitted through online portal. Got email saying wanted to interview me for a position within one week. Interviewer said had a 3 week hiring deadline. Was told a second interview would be the next step. Lasted about 30 min.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experiences that relate to the job description.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was a series of questions highly focused in Freelance work and client relationships.
This office also functions solely on referrals—to receive a job a current designer must know and refer you to the open position. If you apply without a referral, you will be overlooked once a referral comes in (If one comes in before the hiring process is completed).
Interview Questions: Let's say you are working on a large print order and a student comes in and needs a poster right this second or he will fail his class. How would you handle this situation?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: get in touch with professor and enroll into his research, by proving your capability in research and with good gpa you can get the interview. Prepare for a presentation to present to the hiring authorities
Interview Questions: my ability to teach and my previous experience

title: Math Corps Summer Program Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wayne State in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: You first have to take a test, then complete an interview. The test is to see what level of math you know in order to distinguish what grade level and area of math you would be suited best for.  The interview is for them to get to know you more and see who you are behind what they see on paper
Interview Questions: What does it mean to be a mentor to students?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Email contact with supervisor and in contact person interview. After one week again have a small session about the potential research and outcome. Finally got the offer by email and then a hard copy.  I would say it's up to the professor.
Interview Questions: Previous research

title: Enrollment Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Contacted about 2-3 weeks after submitting application. Asked to come in for an hour long interview. Met with potential supervisor and two other managers who took turns asking questions. Fairly straight forward. Vague about when they would get back to me and about 3 weeks later I got the form email from HR saying I did not get the position.
Interview Questions: What is something you've done recently to improve your customer service skills?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied Financial Analysis, FIN 5000, was a new course being introduced to the university and after two semester of student feedback Teaching Assistants were needed in order to help out. The professor approached me for the position and offered me a role to assist him with the class. The only way to actually get the position is to be straightforward and show that you have the skills and what it takes to be able to manage in a such a position. After getting accepted you need to have a background check done with the university, and then you'll be all set for the job.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified to be a TA for this vacant position?

title: Audio Engineer - WDET Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted maybe two weeks after submitting an application and set up a phone interview that lasted about 20 minutes.  From there I was told to submit a wide range of audio materials like podcasts and songs that I have worked on.  After they reviewed them and liked them, the interview process went forward with one more talk on the phone and then I was invited on campus for an in-person interview with four people which went really well.  They even mentioned to me that my responses were great and that I came across as very mature.  They spoke as though I already had the position.

Unfortunately I'm 95% sure the interview was fake.  

One day after my interview I emailed each of the people who interviewed me with specific questions about things they brought up during my interview.  None of them replied.

Weeks went by and I still didn't hear anything so I emailed the main person I was in touch with and later tried to reach him by phone as well.  Despite being told he was in his office, he did not answer and would not return my voice message.  All I wanted was closure as this affected where I would be living once I got married, but nothing.

Eventually I found out I didn't get the job - not from Wayne State or WDET - they never even let me know.  Instead I found out someone I already worked with got the position and was starting soon.  He knew about it for weeks.

Also he went to Wayne State with the people who made the decision.  I'm thoroughly convinced that the team knew who they were going to hire in advance and simply had to do a certain number of interviews as a formality.  I found it very unprofessional that they couldn't even let me know my status.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest mistake in your career so far?

title: Talent Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the Talent Management Coordinator position, I was contacted about 3 weeks later for a phone screen. The phone screen went very well and I was told I would updated in about a week.  At that time I was told they would be moving forward with an internal candidate. I was advised to continue to apply if any further positions became available.
Interview Questions: Why do you like working in HR?

title: News Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: research stories, produce shows, get coffee, make my way in the world of radio spot news in the city of Detroit. also be prepared  to be in a cramped room for hours on end  interviewing people
Interview Questions: Do you have any clips?

title: Accreditation Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. The first was with the direct supervisor, who showed me around the school and we had a chance to talk about the job, what they were looking for and my qualifications. The second was with a dean and another administrator which was more of a formal interview. I was offered the position not too long after that.
Interview Questions: How would you approach the a problem (which they specified)

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: As my visa was going to expire at that time, so I just took phone interview talk about background, research paper. The interview last about one hour in very friendly atmosphere. There was no difficult questions at all. The supervisor was very familiar with my work, and as interested in it, and seems very satisfied with my work, and gave offer immediately.
Interview Questions: What will you do after postdoctoral research

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview for Teaching Assistant Position but we had to perform well for the exams such as Speaking test to show the clarity and fluency of speaking english as a non native speaker. It was not hard at all
Interview Questions: Describe yourself

title: Community Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Each stage of the Interview Process moved up the management hierarchy for Residential Housing department of the University. The department places emphasis on a full commitment to the job. One common requirement for the job is to be available 24 hours for a certain amount of time (i.e. one week).
Interview Questions: What's an example of conflict resolution you have had to mediate?

title: Institutional Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very smooth. Secretary was very helpful in scheduling the time back and forth. Most questions were focused on the job descriptions, like former experience, skills, etc. Not many out-of-box questions in the process. Interview team was very nice and warm. Definitely a great place to begin your career.
Interview Questions: Do you think you are over qualified for this position given your former experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Long, but fair.  I had to send them documents and references but that is to be expected.  The more relevant the references, the better.  They were fair in what they asked.  I was in front of a panel of three professors and it was down to me and one other candidate.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Application, Telephone Notification and onsite Interview and offer. I applied for the position online, Received a telephone for notification a three days later, schedule for onsite interview the next week and then received an offer and background screening took 1month. I was officially given the position and handing over. I don't appreciate anything about the position because i don't like the pay, i took it just to survive the crises at the time.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself
What can you bring to the center?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Resume review was done via online application though college portal.
Then on site interview was conducted. The onsite interview was pretty comfortable and the manager made me feel home before starting to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Everything about me and some technical questions.

title: Early Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume to the supervisor and she invited me for an interview. It was a group interview. She asked our schedule first and then asked why we this position and what experiences do we have. We then observed a therapist with a child and took a quiz.
Interview Questions: I didn't expect a quiz, but it wasn't too difficult.

title: Assistant to Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed scheduled by HR
1st interview was with 3 people (2 directors, and the employee leaving)
2nd interview was with 2 people (HR consultant and the Dean)
Offer came within one day of my last interview.  
Onboarding was easy and straightforward
Interview Questions:
Will you bend the rules
How do you prioritize work
How do you gain confidence from others

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the Principal Investigator and a research coordinator. Very friendly and felt comfortable during the whole interview process. Was asked questions about past experiences. Very straightforward interview questions.
Interview Questions: None that I can think of. It was a very straighforward interview.

title: Wood Shop Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I didn't have an interview. I was a regular at the Woodshop for a few years, having proven my skills and knowledge time and time again. I was good friends with the existing two employees, who recommended me and gave great feedback as peers.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have working around wood / metal machinery?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1 round, just one to one interview. Generally it was all about our previous experience and interest to learn about the specific position title. Generally it was all about our previous experience and interest to learn about the specific position title
Interview Questions: Previous Experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: After seeing an ad online, I submitted my resume and was emailed about an interview. I came in and the wait was very short. I saw my new manager as soon as I walked in the door and she called me back immediately.  The building was small and most of the employees knew each other so finding new or lost people  was a breeze.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in business?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a very relaxed interview process. Took the time to ask questions, and hear about the challenges of the job. it was great, very informative. HR was very efficient at communicating ever step of the way.
Interview Questions: Computer skills

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: Standard. You'll go to a finance conference, they'll fly you out for a presentation on campus if they like you, you will get to meet the faculty, have lunch and dinner with the faculty, get to meet the PhD students, discuss compensation etc.
Interview Questions: None. Pretty standard.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: flied in from Houston and met with prof in the morning. I talked  and had a lunch with him. after that I met with group member and gave a talk about my previous work.
Interview Questions: what is the motivation for you to come WSU

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wayne State
Interview Descriptions: not bad, no STAR type questions, WSU now has background checks
Interview Questions: there are no difficult questions or unexpected questions if you have experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I spoke directly with one of the supervisors who told me where to turn in my application and asked me when I could start.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant/Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired through networking with a researcher with whom I'd had contact for several months, she recruited me, no questions asked, other than salary negotiation.
Interview Questions: It was 12 years ago, I really don't remember anything at all that was difficult or unexpected.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Lecture on the state of affairs within and around the city of Detroit, along with a brief history of Michigan and how it ruled the world 100 years ago.  Word.
Interview Questions: How tall are you?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Analytical Chemistry Division faculty. Pleasant and professional, they really want to get a feel for what your interested doing research in. If they can see you as a member of their lab they will recommend your acceptance to the program.
Interview Questions: What research experience did you have in your Undergraduate studies?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The individual department doing the interview handled it very well.  The Human Resources department was poorly organized.  Before they called me to offer me the position, they sent me a rejection letter.
Interview Questions: I didn't find any question too difficult or unexpected.  They were mostly interested in my knowledge of university policies and procedures.

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: WSU conducted a panel interview. This interview was attended by the director as well as all of the department's assoc directors- about ten people in all. Difficult interview; lots of questions; well over an hour in answering. Lots of ethical questions.
Interview Questions: The questions were pretty much scripted- all the interviewers had the same question sheet. Questions were posed about situational scenarios and how you would handle them.

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Basic, you interview with a panel. Then with the individual or team members you'll be working with to determine if you would be a good addition to their team. Your work ethic was questioned and how you would handle various issues.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would solve issues with students

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
This was an average interview with standard questions. Given by the head of the department with an assistant. Why do you want this job? What are your future goals? How do you deal with difficult people?
Interview was approximately 20 minutes. Polite and professional.
Interview Questions: To identify an area of personal growth.

title: Student Assistant/Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wayne State in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through Wayne State student employment agency (CSO) . The received a call within a matter of days. I came in for the interview and I was offered the position , right there on the spot.
Interview Questions: Would I be comfortable in the close working environment ?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of three individuals. All of them were very nice. The interview lasted about one hour, but the time went quickly. It was very conversational, and they encouraged me to ask questions as well. I would encourage you to dress in a suit, regardless of the position. I would also encourage you to be early, and have multiple copies of your resume available, in case the interviewers were not provided with them.
Interview Questions: What keeps me awake at night?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position and HR representative called me immediately after. The interview was set up and was an easy process. I got the job offer.  This was not a difficult interview process and everything was clearly explained and understood.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straightforward. The interview didn't last long. Supervisor conducted the interview. Interviewer asked me about previous work experience and my grades. Interviewer asked me about my grades in my Calculus courses. She wanted to know if I had received a B average or higher in the courses.
Interview Questions: Have you taken Calculus? Did you receive a B average or higher?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview
Interview Questions: Skills and behavior questions.  Follow the star format when answering.  No question really stood out as being hard.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Received an email, contacted by hiring manager and scheduled a time and place. Was nervous but I felt very relaxed once I met the people here
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself five years from now?

title: Applications Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applying for any job begins online.  I received a telephone to call to set up the interview.  The interview consisted of a one to one meeting with a supervisor (unsure of exact title), and two weeks later, I was informed that the position had been filled by someone other than myself.
Interview Questions: What would you say is your biggest weakness?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wayne State (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. The first one was an individual interview with myself and a Community Director. The second was a group interview with myself and everyone who was applying for the position. It was an opportunity for our employers to see how we could function in a group setting. Overall, the people who did the hiring are people with great personality so my advice would be to be yourself and have positive things to say when you speak.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wayne State in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: I think this experience is PI dependent. Mine is OK
Interview Questions: N/A
